p: To evaluate policy alternatives, we consider two scenarios. The development of the mean annual fuel price over time for each of the scenarios is shown in Fig 3. The first is the business-as-usual case (BAU). A proportionate subsidy of 30.7% [ 95] in the form of tax exemptions has formed the most important component of subsidies [ 25, 71] since the 1960s. The second scenario considers the case in which the tax-exemption is linearly decreased over 15 years until subsidies are fully eliminated (“melt-down,” md), which enables a gradual transition for fishers and consumers. The price plateaus in 2034, but its level is about 600 FCFA higher under the reform scenario than under the BAU scenario.
